com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.objects.data_import

Class EnrichmentControlMetadataBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.objects.data_import.EnrichmentControlMetadataBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class EnrichmentControlMetadataBean
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Bean controlling an enrichment configuration
    Author:
    acp
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ENRICHMENT_PIPELINE
      If used in an analytic thread then should be in this array inside the job's "config" field
      static String UNKNOWN_GROUPING_FIELDS 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected EnrichmentControlMetadataBean() 
        EnrichmentControlMetadataBean(String name, List<String> dependencies, List<String> grouping_fields, Boolean enabled, String module_name_or_id, List<String> library_names_or_ids, String entry_point, LinkedHashMap<String,Object> config, LinkedHashMap<String,Object> technology_override)
      User constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Map<String,Object> config()
      The enrichment-module-specific configuration that controls the per-bucket enrichment
      List<String> dependencies()
      Defines the dependency order of enrichment - this can be used by the framework to optimize runtime
      Boolean enabled()
      Returns if this enrichment is currently enabled - implicitly disables all dependent enrichments
      String entry_point()
      The entry point class of the module to execute; can be used to override the shared library's entry point (or if the entry point is not specified)
      List<String> grouping_fields()
      Where supported (will generally be supported with restrictions for enrichment technologies used in aleph2, eg in Hadoop only once per bucket) enables the incoming data objects to be grouped by this list of fields (each module instance then sees only records with this grouping) Can be set to "?" in which case it is the responsibility of the module to set the fields
      List<String> library_names_or_ids()
      A list of ids or names (within either the bucket or global library) of enrichment JARs to be used as part of this enrichment.
      String module_name_or_id()
      An optional primary module containing application logic within the analytic technology The difference vs the library_names_or_ids is that the library bean (And hence its entry point) is accessible from the context hence no entry_point need then be specified
      String name()
      The name of the enrichment - must be unique within the list of enrichments in this bucket (used for search/display/dependencies)
      Map<String,Object> technology_override()
      The enrichment technology specific configuration JSON for how this module is executed (eg num_reducers in hadoop)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • ENRICHMENT_PIPELINE

        public static final String ENRICHMENT_PIPELINE
        If used in an analytic thread then should be in this array inside the job's "config" field
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UNKNOWN_GROUPING_FIELDS

        public static final String UNKNOWN_GROUPING_FIELDS
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • EnrichmentControlMetadataBean

        protected EnrichmentControlMetadataBean()

      • EnrichmentControlMetadataBean

        public EnrichmentControlMetadataBean(String name,
                                     List<String> dependencies,
                                     List<String> grouping_fields,
                                     Boolean enabled,
                                     String module_name_or_id,
                                     List<String> library_names_or_ids,
                                     String entry_point,
                                     LinkedHashMap<String,Object> config,
                                     LinkedHashMap<String,Object> technology_override)
        User constructor
        Parameters:
        name - - The name of the job - optional but required if it is needed as a dependency
        dependencies - - the dependency order of enrichment - this can be used by the framework to optimize runtime
        grouping_fields - - where supported (analytic technology specific), each module instance will see a stream of data objects grouped by this field set
        enabled - - Whether the job is currently enabled, defaults to true
        module_name_or_id - - An optional primary module containing application logic within the analytic technology
        library_names_or_ids - - An optional list of addition modules required on the classpath
        entry_point - - the entry point class of the module to execute; can be used to override the shared library's entry point (or if the entry point is not specified)
        config - - The enrichment module specific module configuration JSON
        technology_override - - The enrichment technology specific configuration JSON for how this module is executed (eg num_reducers in hadoop)

    • Method Detail

      • name

        public String name()
        The name of the enrichment - must be unique within the list of enrichments in this bucket (used for search/display/dependencies)
        Returns:
        the name

      • dependencies

        public List<String> dependencies()
        Defines the dependency order of enrichment - this can be used by the framework to optimize runtime
        Returns:
        the dependencies

      • grouping_fields

        public List<String> grouping_fields()
        Where supported (will generally be supported with restrictions for enrichment technologies used in aleph2, eg in Hadoop only once per bucket) enables the incoming data objects to be grouped by this list of fields (each module instance then sees only records with this grouping) Can be set to "?" in which case it is the responsibility of the module to set the fields
        Returns:
        the field list to group ("?" for unknown)

      • enabled

        public Boolean enabled()
        Returns if this enrichment is currently enabled - implicitly disables all dependent enrichments
        Returns:
        the enabled

      • module_name_or_id

        public String module_name_or_id()
        An optional primary module containing application logic within the analytic technology The difference vs the library_names_or_ids is that the library bean (And hence its entry point) is accessible from the context hence no entry_point need then be specified
        Returns:
        An optional primary module containing application logic within the analytic technology

      • library_names_or_ids

        public List<String> library_names_or_ids()
        A list of ids or names (within either the bucket or global library) of enrichment JARs to be used as part of this enrichment. Exactly one of the JARs must be of type IEnrichmentBatchModule or IEnrichmentBatchTopology
        Returns:
        the library_ids_or_names

      • entry_point

        public String entry_point()
        The entry point class of the module to execute; can be used to override the shared library's entry point (or if the entry point is not specified)
        Returns:
        (optional) the entry point class to run the module that defines the job

      • config

        public Map<String,Object> config()
        The enrichment-module-specific configuration that controls the per-bucket enrichment
        Returns:
        the config

      • technology_override

        public Map<String,Object> technology_override()
        The enrichment technology specific configuration JSON for how this module is executed (eg num_reducers in hadoop)
        Returns:
        the technology override fields (documented per enrichment technology)
